intro: Echinospermum barbatum var. cariense, commonly known as the hairy echinothecium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features woolly, hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
